note.p: Death: His House, 41 Norfolk Square, London (08 November 1908)
Education: University College School; University College, London. BA (1867)

Career: Worked for the Indian Telegraphic Service (1868-1873); Professor of Physics and Telegraphy, Imperial College of Engineering, Tokyo, Japan (1873-1878); undertook researches with John Perry (FRS 1885); Professor, City and Guilds of London Institute (1879); Professor, Centreal Technical College, South Kensington (1884-1908); Chairman, Editing Committee, Council of the Society of Telegraph Engineers
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1911 vol 85 pp i-viii signed by J P
References: Joan Mason, 'Hertha Ayrton (1854-1923) and the Admission of Women to the Royal Society of London' in NR 1991 vol 45 pp 201-220
